titles.title: To amend the Small Business Act to modify the method for prescribing size standards for business concerns.
Small Business Runway Extension Act of 2018

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported by the Committee on Small Business. H. Rept. 115-939.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 730.

action.text: Mr. Chabot moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6330.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.
Senate Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
Small Business Runway Extension Act of 2018
(Sec. 2) This bill amends the Small Business Act to revise certain requirements for prescribing size standards for small businesses. Such standards shall be calculated using average annual gross receipts of such businesses from at least the previous five (currently, three) years.
